video_details.title: Henri Stern I Server Wallets With Privy I Agentic Ethereum 2025
video_details.description:
Join Henri Stern with Privy for a workshop titled "Server Wallets With Privy".

Agentic Ethereum is an online, async hackathon that runs from Jan. 31 to Feb. 12, 2025.  With over $175,000 USD in prizes, Agentic Ethereum is a great way to dive into the world of autonomous AI agents and explore how they can revolutionize projects on Ethereum. Start the year with groundbreaking innovation!

----------------

Follow us:  

https://x.com/ethglobal
Check us out: https://ethglobal.com
Email us at: hello@ethglobal.com

captions.text: [Music]
hello I am super excited to talk to you
about server wallets today server
wallets give you direct access to
previous wallet infrastructure via
powerful low-level apis so where privy
embedded wallets are typically used to
onboard users to crypto no matter how
familiar they are with crypto or not
server wallets give your application
access to the drill assets at scale by
giving you a low programmable library
that you can use to spin up and manage
wallets directly from your back end this
means you can basically spin up fleets
of wallets at scale across Bitcoin
salana any evm chain you have robust
transaction control so you decide
exactly what happens and a powerful
policy engine so you can decide what
transactions are allowed and which
aren't and who transactions can be
submitted by in all cases server wallets
are spun up with basically a wallet
owner and that owner is the one who can
submit transactions for that wallet I'll
kind of show you how they work so here
we have a simple demo that we set up to
show off server wallets as you see I
making curl requests basically to spin
up new wallets and so here I'm building
up my fleet of wallets I've got four now
and as I do this it's uh really a simple
API call to generate in this case an
ethereum wallet from here I'm going to
trigger a transaction to receive funds
on chain and here the uh web hook
actually just fired and I see that I now
have 01 eth in Ox D1 and I can transfer
those funds onwards if I want again all
of this is happening via API calls and
as you can see all of this is actually
happening onchain in real time so the
point really is to give you much simpler
means of controlling money movement at
scale for your entire application your
customers your users um so there you
have it server wallets are new way to
access embedded wallets directly from a
back end we're excited for you to take
them out for a spin uh please reach out
if you want to really access w
[Music]
